results.adx_keywords: Bedbugs;Pest Control;Politics and Government;Olympic Games (2024);Paris (France);France
results.title: City of Light or City of Bites? France Tries to Ease Bedbug Anxiety.
results.abstract: With less than a year to go before millions are expected in Paris for the Olympics, a wave of widely publicized reports of bedbug infestations has put French authorities under pressure.

media.caption: A biocide technician removing pillowcases to prevent the spread of bedbugs in an apartment near Paris last month.

results.adx_keywords: Black People;Voting Rights, Registration and Requirements;Redistricting and Reapportionment;Alabama
results.title: Alabama Is Ordered to Use Map With Two Districts That Empower Black Voters
results.abstract: The new district map is a remedy to Alabama’s illegal dilution of Black voting power, and may lead to the election of two Black representatives for the first time in the state’s history.

media.caption: People waiting outside the federal courthouse in Birmingham, Ala., in August, for a hearing reviewing the state’s congressional map.

results.title: ‘Antiracism’ Was Never the Right Answer
results.abstract: Ibram X. Kendi became a national arbiter on race, even though his reductionist approach was at odds with principles of free inquiry and expression.

results.title: Haiti Doesn’t Need More Guns. It Needs a New Government.
results.abstract: The U.N. approved sending a multinational security force to tackle Haiti’s gang crisis. What the nation really needs is a new government.

media.caption: Police officers leaving after a news conference held to show weapons confiscated during an anti-gang operation in Port-au-Prince, Haiti, on April 26.

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Halls of Fame;Football;Butkus, Dick;Chicago Bears;National Football League
results.title: Dick Butkus, Fearsome Hall of Fame Linebacker, Is Dead at 80
results.abstract: He was both hard hitting against the run and fleet-footed in foiling pass plays in his eight seasons with the Chicago Bears. He later took up acting.

media.caption: Dick Butkus of the Chicago Bears in 1966. “When I went out on the field to warm up, I would manufacture things to make me mad,” he said.

results.abstract: He may have to defend the faith in Mongolia against pressure from China’s ruling Communist Party.

results.adx_keywords: Firearms;Threats and Threatening Messages;Politics and Government;Evers, Tony (1951- );Democratic Party;Madison (Wis);Wisconsin
results.title: Armed Man Seeking Wisconsin Governor Posts Bail and Returns With Rifle
results.abstract: The man was taken into custody inside the State Capitol on Wednesday after asking to see Gov. Tony Evers, the authorities said. He posted bail and returned hours later with a rifle.

media.caption: A man armed with a handgun was arrested after he went to the State Capitol in Madison, Wis., on Wednesday seeking Gov. Tony Evers. Hours later, he returned with an “AK-47-style” rifle, a state spokeswoman said.
media.copyright: Narayan Mahon for The New York Times

results.title: Why Summers May Never Be the Same
results.abstract: The globe’s warmest months on record redefined summer for many Americans.

media.caption: In the summer of 2023, no matter where you lived, it was difficult to ignore how our shifting climate has upended many rites of the season.

results.title: Bidens’ Dog Is No Longer at White House After Latest Biting Incident
